english_text: Hello friends Today we are embarking on a journey to Bhojpur District
This district is located in Province No 1 of Nepal and it holds its own special significance
The natural beauty of Bhojpur is captivating us right from the start
We plan to visit some of the famous temples here
Our first stop an ancient temple in Bhojpur The peaceful atmosphere here is calming my mind
I am deeply impressed by the rich history of this temple
The culture and traditions of Bhojpur are quite unique
People here are very proud of their language and culture
Now we are heading towards Bhojpur market where we can find local products
Handicrafts from Bhojpur are very popular in this market
Welcome to Jhapa a district of stunning landscapes rich culture and heartwarming people
A place where every corner tells a story and every story feels like home
Birtamod the heart of Jhapa is where modernity meets tradition
The bustling streets are alive with energy
The people will make you feel like you're part of the family
You must try the food here such as spicy momos and selroti
Local flavors that will explode in your mouth"
The Kankai River flows gently carrying centuries of stories
People come here for spiritual cleansing and it feels like the river washes away all your worries
But sadly the river is also a reminder of how climate change is affecting our natural resources
We must protect it
The sacred Arjundhara Temple also known as the Pashupatinath of the east This place is truly magical
The energy the prayers the offerings it all makes you feel connected to something greater
I must say walking around the temple at night gives you goosebumps
There's an eerie silence but its peaceful at the same time
Dhulabari is the shoppers paradise
Whether its clothes electronics or spices this market has it all And the bargaining? its a skill you'll need
But beware sometimes the prices can get ridiculously high for tourists Dont get ripped off
Gauradaha known for its beautiful wetlands Migratory birds from all over the world come here
Watching them feels like a dance between earth and sky
Sadly the littering around this place is quite disturbing
We need to keep these wetlands clean or well lose this beauty forever
Satashidham a hidden gem tucked away from the busy streets
The fresh air the sound of birds chirping its like stepping into a different world
The temple complex here is serene
People come to pray meditate and just breathe in peace
The tribes in Jhapa like the Rajbanshi and Limbu bring so much life and color to the region
Their festivals dances and unique traditions will leave you in awe
But many of these traditions are slowly fading away as modernity takes over Its heartbreaking
And the food From dhido to gundruk the flavors of Jhapa are as diverse as its people
Every bite tells a story of generations
Most people here live off the land
Farming tea estates and livestock are their main sources of livelihood
Its a simple life but theres beauty in that simplicity
Yet with rising costs and unpredictable weather many farmers are struggling to make ends meet
Jhapa is more than just a destination
Its an experience that stays with you
The warmth of the people the beauty of the landscapes and the rich culture make you want to come back again and again
The lush green tea gardens of Jhapa stretch as far as the eye can see
Walking through them you feel like youve entered a sea of greenery peaceful and endless
The meeting point of the Kankai and Ratuwa rivers
Its a place of power and tranquility where natures beauty leaves you in awe
The town of Pathari may seem small but it is full of life and stories
The lively markets and friendly people make you feel instantly welcomed
The dense Charali Forest is home to many rare birds and animals
Walking through its shaded paths theres a sense of adventure and mystery in every step
Standing on the Mechi Bridge watching the river flow beneath you feel the invisible line between Nepal and India
Its humbling and surreal
The calm of Bhadrapur contrasts with the busy life of the bigger towns
Its a perfect spot to reflect and enjoy the slow rhythm of life
The traditional Rajbanshi houses made of bamboo and thatch show the simplicity and beauty of the local way of life
During the monsoon the rice fields of Jhapa turn into a green carpet that glows in the rain
Its a sight that fills your heart with peace
The folk songs you hear in the villages of Jhapa are full of emotion telling stories of love loss and lifes simplicity
The sweets in Jhapas local shops like khuwa and anarsa are made with love
Each bite feels like a taste of the regions heritage
Kechana Kabal the lowest point in Nepal feels like standing on the edge of the world a quiet spot untouched by time
Watching the reflection of the sky on Mai Pokhari you feel like you're in a painting The stillness is otherworldly
The historical site of Kichakbadh tells tales of epic battles
As you stand here you can almost hear the clashing swords of the past
The vast open fields of Gherabari seem to stretch endlessly
Standing there you feel so small in the grandness of nature
The small town of Baigundhura is filled with warm people and simple joys
The smiles of the children running around fill your heart with happiness
Walking through this park dedicated to a local hero you feel proud of Jhapas heritage and the stories of courage it carries
The sound of the Satasidham waterfall crashing down fills you with energy
Its a reminder of natures unstoppable power
Watching a local football match at Mechi Stadium the cheers of the crowd echo in your ears filling you with the thrill of competition
The Rajbanshi cuisine rich in flavor and tradition reminds you of how food brings people together
Each dish feels like a celebration
The sense of community in Jhapa is strong
Neighbors help each other and festivals bring everyone together
